metadata.Title: CVE-2010-3854 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the webadministration interface (aka Futon) in Apache CouchDB 0.8.0 through 1.0.1allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

couchdb - 1.2.0-2ubuntu1
couchdb-bin - 1.2.0-2ubuntu1
couchdb-common - 1.2.0-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: couchdb package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.0-2ubuntu1').
